dbms.buffermanager

Class BufferManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbms.buffermanager.BufferManager

  • public class BufferManager
extends java.lang.Object
    DBMS component that manages the buffer pool. This component allows other DBMS components to do the following:
    • Request a page.
    • Release a page.
    • Allocate a page to a file.
    • Deallocate a page from a file.
    • Flush a dirty page.
    Author:
    Edgar

      • BufferManager

        public BufferManager(int bufferSize,
             java.lang.String policy)
              throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                     java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.SecurityException,
                     java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                     java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Creates a buffer manager with the specified size and buffer replacement policy.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - Size of the buffer pool.
        policy - The policy that will be followed in replacing pages.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException

    • Method Detail

      • pinPage

        public Page pinPage(java.lang.String filename,
           int pageId)
             throws BadFileException,
                    BadPageNumberException,
                    DBFileException
        Pins a page in buffer pool. If the page is not yet in the buffer pool, look for an available frame for this page, make a copy of the page, and pin it. Write out the old page, if it is dirty, before reading.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of file that contains the page to be pinned.
        pageId - The page id of the page to be pinned.
        Returns:
        A reference to the page that is pinned in the buffer pool. If the page is not in the buffer pool and there is no available frame, return null.
        Throws:
        BadFileException - If the file does not exist.
        BadPageNumberException - If the page does not exist.
        DBFileException - If the page is not allocated.

      • unpinPage

        public void unpinPage(java.lang.String filename,
             int pageId,
             boolean dirty)
               throws PageNotPinnedException
        Unpins a page in the buffer pool. If the pin count of the page is greater than 0, decrement its pin count. If the pin count becomes zero, it is appropriately included in a group of replacement candidates.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of file that contains the page to be unpinned.
        pageId - The page id of the page to be pinned.
        dirty - Indicates whether or not the page is dirty.
        Throws:
        PageNotPinnedException - If the page is not pinned.

      • newPage

        public int newPage(java.lang.String filename,
          int numPages)
            throws DBFileException,
                   BadFileException,
                   BadPageNumberException
        Requests a new set of pages from the underlying database, then finds a frame in the buffer pool for the page page and pins it. Return the pageId of the first page that is allocated for the file. If the buffer pool is full, no new pages are allocated from the database and Page.NO_PAGE_NUMBER is returned.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of file where the pages will be allocated.
        numPages - The number of pages to be allocated.
        Returns:
        The pageId of the first page that is allocated for the file.
        Throws:
        DBFileException - If the number of pages is not positive or a write to an unallocated page is requested.
        BadFileException - If the file does not exist.
        BadPageNumberException - If the page does not exist.

      • freePage

        public void freePage(java.lang.String filename,
            int pageId)
              throws PagePinnedException,
                     DBFileException,
                     BadPageNumberException
        Deallocates a page from the underlying database. Verifies that the page is not pinned. If the page is not in the buffer pool, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of file containing the page to be deallocated.
        pageId - The pageId of the page to be deallocated.
        Throws:
        PagePinnedException - If the page is pinned.
        DBFileException - If the number of pages to be deallocated is not positive.
        BadPageNumberException - If the page does not exist.

      • flushPage

        public void flushPage(java.lang.String filename,
             int pageId)
               throws BadFileException,
                      BadPageNumberException,
                      DBFileException
        Flushes (writes) a page from the buffer pool to the underlying database if it is dirty. If page is not dirty, it is not flushed. If the page is not in the buffer pool, do nothing, since the page is effectively flushed already.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of file containing the page to be flushed.
        pageId - The pageId of the page to be flushed.
        Throws:
        BadFileException - If the file does not exist.
        BadPageNumberException - If the page does not exist.
        DBFileException - If the page is not allocated.

      • flushPages

        public void flushPages()
                throws BadFileException,
                       BadPageNumberException,
                       DBFileException
        Flushes all dirty pages from the buffer pool to the underlying database. If a page is not dirty, it is not flushed.
        Throws:
        BadFileException - If a page that belongs to a deleted (or a nonexistent) file will be flushed.
        BadPageNumberException - If a page that is already deleted from the database will be flushed.
        DBFileException - If an unallocated page will be flushed.

      • findPage

        public Page findPage(java.lang.String filename,
            int pageId)
        Finds the page in the buffer pool with the specified filename and page Id.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file containing the page.
        pageId - The page Id of the file containing the page.
        Returns:
        The page in the buffer pool with the specified filename and page Id, null if the page is not in the buffer pool.

      • findFrame

        public int findFrame(java.lang.String filename,
            int pageId)
        Finds the frame in the buffer pool containing the page with the specified filename and page Id.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file containing the page.
        pageId - The page Id of the file containing the page.
        Returns:
        The frame number of the frame containing the page , -1 if the page is not in the buffer pool.

      • getPoolSize

        public int getPoolSize()
        Gets the size of the buffer pool.
        Returns:
        The size of the buffer pool.
